title: Enrollment Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at National University of Singapore
Interview Descriptions: My interview was virtual with two leaders. They go back and forth asking a series of questions. You may have another interviewee on the call with you, always be prepared.
Interview Questions: Why do want to be an Enrollment Advisor?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at National University of Singapore
Interview Descriptions: You need to do a 10-15 mins presentation and then 4 committee asked 4-5 questions about what can teach and how. Overall 30 mins. Quick and fast. Get feedback relatively late. Overall process is about one month.
Interview Questions: What course you would like to offer in our department

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at National University of Singapore
Interview Descriptions: It was uneven. I met several interesting, dynamic people. Hospitality during the on-campus interview was great. But the committee was clearly not working as a team. One professor was surprised I'd consider moving to Singapore with a family, even though I'd been open from the start about it. The same person really insisted that I quote his work during my job talk which was super weird.
Interview Questions: Except for that one weird guy, most other questions were standard academic interview questions about scholarship, experience. They also wanted to really double-check if I'd want to live in Singapore.

title: MSC Management Interview Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at National University of Singapore
Interview Descriptions: The process was smooth, with "no jump scare" surprises. The questions are similar to what one would expect in graduate applications to business schools. Just make sure to keep up with the pace while hitting your main points.
Interview Questions: What are some qualities that you would like to see in your boss

title: Reasearch Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at National University of Singapore
Interview Descriptions: Face to face interview with PI . Met with research group. They asked great questions and we had great discussion around some topics. Very nice people and great team. They also gave a lab tour to me which is very helpful to have an idea of the working environment
Interview Questions: How to Troubleshoot when see certain abnormal result from experiments

title: Finance PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at National University of Singapore
Interview Descriptions: Group Interview with 3 professors in related fields. Asked about research experience and views about a given paper.  Asked to explain the methodology and potential issues and improvement. Q & A part after interview.
Interview Questions: Why NUS? Why Finance? What schools did you also apply to?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at National University of Singapore
Interview Descriptions: The first round is pre-interview and will ask general questions; The second round is formal interview and will ask to do two presentations on past research and future plan. Overall, the interview process is very similar to US, and is very professional.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to come to NUS

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at National University of Singapore
Interview Descriptions:
I had a 30 min interview with the hiring professor. She 
mainly went through items on CV. She also describe the project I will be working on if hired, and asked about my career plan.

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at National University of Singapore (Washington, DC) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Original personal who was to interview me canceled 6 times and it was a revolving door of excuses as to each cancellation.  This is just unacceptable for someone who is really looking for jobs.

title: CS PhD Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at National University of Singapore
Interview Descriptions: General questions about yourself, reasons for PhD, why Singapore, and also questions about your past research, future research interests.  The interviewer is a professor at SoC, and the process is about 20 mins.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to come to NUS for phd?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at National University of Singapore
Interview Descriptions: it was in the same group so not much of an interview. but usually it involves a presentation of research experience and follow up questions, the skills are important than the exact work experience
Interview Questions: all questions based on the presentation made

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at National University of Singapore
Interview Descriptions: This was for the PhD position at YLL School of Medicine. Regular PhD questions of why, what are your interests, post PhD plans; relocation to Singapore, potential lab interests. Easy enough. They specifically asked about the techniques I have learned. They also asked about grades.
Interview Questions: One particular technique I had done two years ago. I managed to say the basics, but I honestly couldn't remember the details; as I'd done it only two.three times.

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at National University of Singapore
Interview Descriptions: Know the employer's work well, be very confident with our niche expertise and how our expertise could be amalgamated to their work. Be vocal, ask questions and give relevant input.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you face more failures than successes in your work?
